snippet: The attacks in Mogadishu, the capital, appeared to have been coordinated, witnesses and officials said. At least six civilians were reported wounded.
abstract: Somalian officials say that Shabab militants attacked two hotels in Mogadishu, wounding at least six civilians and leaving at least 18 of militants dead.
lead_paragraph: The attacks in Mogadishu, the capital, appeared to have been coordinated, witnesses and officials said. At least six civilians were reported wounded.

headline.main: Shabab Militants Strike 2 Hotels in Somalia
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Africa; Somalia: Shabab Militants Strike 2 Hotels in Capital
